clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Simultaneous Dual Stimulation on Freezing of Gait in Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Simultaneous Dual Stimulation on Freezing of Gait in Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of dual-mode non-invasive brain stimulation (NIBS) with high-frequency repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) over the primary motor cortex of the lower leg and anodal transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex compared with rTMS alone in patients with Parkinson's disease (PD) with freezing of gait (FOG).

detailed_description.textblock: Patients in the dual-mode group underwent five consecutive daily sessions of dual-mode NIBS with simultaneous high-frequency rTMS and tDCS, whereas patients in the rTMS group underwent high-frequency rTMS with sham tDCS. Assessments of FOG, motor, ambulatory and cognitive function were performed three times: at baseline before NIBS, immediately after NIBS, and one week after cessation of NIBS.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of FOG questionnaire (FOG-Q) from T0 (before NIBS) to T1 (immediately after NIBS, day 5) and T2 (1 week after cessation of NIBS, day 12)
primary_outcome.time_frame: T0, pre-NIBS at day 1; T1, immediately after NIBS at day 5); T2, 1 week after cessation of NIBSat day 12

arm_group.description: the dual-mode NIBS with high-frequency rTMS and tDCS simultaneously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed as Parkinson's disease (PD) with freezing of gait
- walk independently without walking devices
Exclusion Criteria:
- pre-existing and active major neurological diseases other than PD
- a previous history of seizures
- implanted metallic objects that would contraindicate rTMS
